SEARCH
Package org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils.result

Class AttemptsAggregate<T,F extends FailureReason>

java.lang.Object
org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils.result.AttemptsAggregate<T,F>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the successful result.
F - The type representing failure reasons.
public final class AttemptsAggregate<T,F extends FailureReason> extends Object
Aggregates a list of Attempt objects into success and failure categories. This class provides utility methods to handle successful and failed attempts separately.

      Returns:

    • allOf

      public static <T, F extends FailureReason> AttemptsAggregate<T,F> allOf(Attempt<T,F>... attempts)
      Creates an AttemptsAggregate from a varargs array of attempts.

    • emptySuccess

      public static <T, F extends FailureReason> AttemptsAggregate<T,F> emptySuccess()
      Creates an AttemptsAggregate with no attempts, representing an empty success state. In this case, it will be deemed as successful, but attempt counts will be zero.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the successful result.
      F - The type representing failure reasons.
      Returns:
      An instance of AttemptsAggregate with no attempts.

    • onSuccess

      public AttemptsAggregate<T,F> onSuccess(Runnable runnable)
      Executes the provided Runnable if there are successful attempts.
      Parameters:
      runnable - The action to execute on success.
      Returns:
      This AttemptsAggregate instance for method chaining.

    • onFailure

      public AttemptsAggregate<T,F> onFailure(Runnable runnable)
      Executes the provided Runnable if there are failed attempts.
      Parameters:
      runnable - The action to execute on failure.
      Returns:
      This AttemptsAggregate instance for method chaining.

    • onSuccess

      public AttemptsAggregate<T,F> onSuccess(Consumer<List<Attempt<T,F>>> successConsumer)
      Executes the provided Consumer with the list of successful attempts if any exist.
      Parameters:
      successConsumer - The consumer to process successful attempts.
      Returns:
      This AttemptsAggregate instance for method chaining.

    • onFailure

      public AttemptsAggregate<T,F> onFailure(Consumer<List<Attempt<T,F>>> failureConsumer)
      Executes the provided Consumer with the list of failed attempts if any exist.
      Parameters:
      failureConsumer - The consumer to process failed attempts.
      Returns:
      This AttemptsAggregate instance for method chaining.

    • onSuccessCount

      public AttemptsAggregate<T,F> onSuccessCount(Consumer<Integer> successConsumer)
      Executes the provided Consumer with the count of successful attempts if any exist. If count is 0 means it was a emptySuccess().
      Parameters:
      successConsumer - The consumer to process the count of successful attempts.
      Returns:
      This AttemptsAggregate instance for method chaining.

    • onFailureCount

      public AttemptsAggregate<T,F> onFailureCount(Consumer<Map<F,Long>> failureConsumer)
      Executes the provided Consumer with a map of failure reasons and their occurrence counts if any failures exist.
      Parameters:
      failureConsumer - The consumer to process the failure reasons count.
      Returns:
      This AttemptsAggregate instance for method chaining.

    • hasSuccess

      public boolean hasSuccess()
      Checks if there are no failed attempts or has at least one successful attempt.
      Returns:
      true if there are successful attempts, false otherwise.

    • hasFailure

      public boolean hasFailure()
      Checks if there are any failed attempts.
      Returns:
      true if there are failed attempts, false otherwise.
